intro: Gussonea dahomensis, commonly known as the Dahomey gussonea, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squashes, and melons. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically followed by orange to red fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
